data.project_abstract: Geodetic Very Long Baseline Interferometry (VLBI) stands at the forefront of precise measurement of Earth's rotation and orientation. At the core of geodetic VLBI operations lies the International VLBI Service for Geodesy and Astrometry (IVS), a collaborative platform that unites institutions, observatories, and research agencies worldwide. Members of the IVS can submit VLBI-related files to the IVS, such as reports and logs that include a variety of performance metrics. This project aims to enhance geodetic VLBI research by curating these existing performance metrics submitted to the IVS into a common database. The database will consist of three tables, monitoring performance on a session-, station-, and source basis. It will be openly available via a common web interface and an Application Programming Interface (API). The session-based database will serve as a monitoring tool for enabling swift adjustments to observing programs. For this purpose, comprehensive online plotting tools will be developed as part of the web interface. The station and source-based databases can be used to optimize observing plans by excluding poorly performing elements and prioritizing high-performing ones. Thus, this project will enhance data accuracy and foster collaboration within the VLBI community. The project's technological advancements will contribute to open research data initiatives and promote scientific excellence in Earth sciences and geodesy, especially for the IVS community.

work_packages.wp_title: Basic API Functionality for Session Performance
Extended API Functionality for Observation Planning

start_date.reasoning: Combining both sources: the table in the RESEARCH PROPOSAL section (page 2) gives '1 Feb 2024'; in the project narrative (page 16), it states 'We assume that the project will start first of February 2024'. Both indicate the same start date, just worded/formatted differently. Reporting the normalized format with the calculated mean confidence scores.

citation.matching_text: Finally, we plan to attend the IVS GM 2024 in Japan to present our work and discuss its implications with the IVS community. Total travel costs are estimated to be 2750 CHF.
We assume that the project will start first of February 2024 and last for nine months.

total_budget_requested.reasoning: The 'Total requested amount in CHF' in the main BUDGET summary (page 2) is taken as authoritative, as it appears in the summary section, matching closely with the detailed table on page 15 (29991.20 CHF). The difference is minimal, likely due to rounding; I report the summary figure as the total per standard extraction logic.

config.system_prompt:
EXTRACTION STRATEGY:
  1. PRIMARY: Look for data in the specified location/table/section
  2. FALLBACK: If not found, search broader document context for semantically equivalent information
  3. FLEXIBILITY: Allow for format variations, OCR errors, and synonym usage

  LOCATION FLEXIBILITY:
  - Handle table format variations (column/row order, spacing, naming)
  - Consider synonyms and equivalent terms
  - Account for OCR/parsing errors that may affect document quality

  QUALITY STANDARDS:
  - Extract actual values found in the document
  - If uncertain, provide best interpretation with appropriate confidence
  - Only return null if the information category truly doesn't exist
  - Convert abbreviated amounts (k=1000) to full numbers where applicable
  

  METADATA EXTRACTION FOCUS:
  - Project identification: title, acronym, duration, start date
  - Applicant details: names, institutions, functions, addresses
  - Project categorization: Explore/Establish/Contribute classification
  - Keywords and abstract information from research proposal sections
